thread.title: The Internet Is (Rightfully) Obsessed With This Girl's Flower Afro
thread.title_full: The Internet Is (Rightfully) Obsessed With This Girl's Flower Afro

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: The Internet Is (Rightfully) Obsessed With This Girl's Flower Afro
text:
Sorry, Coachella: YouTuber Kiera Please officially has one-upped your flower crowns. Instead of circling her head with dainty floral strands, she bedecks her gorgeous curls with entire bouquets of massive blooms â€“ and the internet can't get enough.
thank you for 30k! ðŸ’™ðŸ’™ðŸ’™
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Apr 2, 2015 at 6:15pm PDT
 ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on May 16, 2015 at 4:07pm PDT
The 21-year-old and her garden-fairy gorgeousness have rocketed to social-media stardom, with over 206K followers on Instagram , 21K YouTube subscribers, and almost 30K Twitter followers. It's gotten to the point where fans are recognizing her IRL.
"I went to a music festival, and a few people who were wearing flowers in their hair came up to me and told me that I had inspired that choice," Kiera told Seventeen.com.
back when I was cute and queen of forest nymphs eternally
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Feb 2, 2017 at 11:58am PST
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Jan 29, 2016 at 4:51pm PST
 3 pictures, 1 day?!Â¿!!Â¿?! Who am I even
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Sep 12, 2015 at 3:59pm PDT
Kiera says her signature style â€” in addition to being beautiful â€” represents her personal growth.
 "To me wearing [blooms] in your hair is more than just a cool look," she explained. "I like to think of myself as gradually blossoming and becoming something more than what I was the day before."
I challenge you to make a quick poem including the words taco, freedom, and Sasquatch ..go!
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Mar 15, 2016 at 2:21pm PDT
A photo posted by human person thing (@kieraplease) on Aug 4, 2015 at 7:32pm PDT
 Want to dupe those ethereal vibes? Just buy some faux blooms (Kiera recommends shopping Michael's or buying florals for cheap from store window displays), remove the stem from each, and stick a bobby pin through the hole. Then, attach the flowers to your strands or roots.
Here's her full tutorial:
*Clicks Subscribe as fast as humanly possible*

From: Seventeen
